title: Fix backend quotes persistence after deployment

requirements.text: Audit `backend/main.mo` and ensure all five quotes are hardcoded in the `getQuotes` query: the original quotes plus 'If teachers teach, why don't doctors doct?', 'If time flies, where does it land?', and 'If you wait faster, are you technically arriving sooner?'. Verify there are no stale or duplicate definitions that could cause older versions to override the latest list during deployment.

quotes: The two most recently added quotes are disappearing after deployment
If teachers teach, why don't doctors doct?
If time flies, where does it land?
If you wait faster, are you technically arriving sooner?

acceptanceCriteria: All quotes including all three recently added ones are present in the hardcoded list in `backend/main.mo`
No duplicate or conflicting quote list definitions exist in the backend actor
After deployment to production, `getQuotes` returns all quotes (none disappear)

constraints: Do not remove or alter any existing quotes
All quote data must remain hardcoded in the backend actor â€” no external database
nonGoals: Adding new quotes beyond the three specified
Changes to frontend quote display or styling
